channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023070810
item.description:
Report X-2023070810

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-05
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found as damaged during the unload process. DescribePack: The metal pail was crused at the cap causing spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Put in lined tote & taken to hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070722
item.description:
Report X-2023070722

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070722 SequenceEvent: ARRIVED FROM PREVIOUS FACILITY WET WITH BOX FALLING APART DescribePack: ONE OF THE LIDS WAS LOOSE RESULTING IN APPROX 1/3 GALLON LEAKING. BOX TOO BIG WITH NO PACKING MATERIALS USED DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING. 2. X-2023070806 SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED FROM PREVIOUS FACILITY WET AND FALLING APART DescribePack: 1 LID WAS COMPLETELY LOOSE RESULTING IN 3/4 GAL LEAKING. BOX WAS COMPROMISED AND OTHER BOTTLES FELL FROM PKG. A SECOND BOTTLE WAS CRUSHED RESULTING IN ANOTHER 1/2 GAL LEAKING DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.

item.description:
Report X-2023070702

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was sent to QA for inspection due to the box being wet. DescribePack: Upon inspection found the contents had a loose cap causing the leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fold absorb was used to mitigate the release.

item.title: Report X-2023070965
item.description:
Report X-2023070965

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found the wet package in the damage hazmat cage. I repackaged it in a salvage drum and filled out the required paperwork. DescribePack: The cap on one of the containers had a loose cap and about 8 oz of content leaked. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The wet package was placed in a tub and taken to the damage hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023070658
item.description:
Report X-2023070658

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: HALETHORPE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: unloading and packaged dropped causing the caps to become loose DescribePack: 1 of the bottles caps was knocked loose due to impact from being dropped DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: taken down to the damage hazmat cage and placed into a yellow hazmat damage storage drum.

item.title: Report E-2023070527
item.description:
Report E-2023070527

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: ELKRIDGE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While freight was being temporarily stored on the loading dock, forklift operator wasn't paying attention to the clearances of his forklift and hit a pail with the forkblades of his forklift consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbents and placed into a recovery container as was the damaged pail.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING DURING SORTATION. DescribePack: THE VENTED CAPS AND SEALS WERE DEFECTIVE CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO SLOWLY LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE FOR PROCESSING.
